descript.abstract: This data set features all roads that were mapped for Enhanced 911 purposes.
descript.purpose: To have an E-911 road spatial database so that street addresses could be assigned to residences in accordance with E-911.

timeperd.current: Last update to this published dataset.

theme.themekey: Transportation, Roads, Road Centerline, NG-911, E-911 Roads, Street, Streets

attracc.attraccr: No complete accuracy checks have been made. Errors have been known to occur during data entry and have been corrected as they are found. All Mandatory fields per NG911 requirements are populated as are Conditional fields where a value exists.

dataqual.logic: GIS software checks are performed for topology consistency during the MnGeo data validation process for NG911.

procstep.procdesc: GPS & Aerial Imagery. This data set was created by GeoComm as part of the E-911 project. It has been maintained by the GIS Coordinator since 2001.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID assigned by software
The first address number in the range of address numbers on the left side of the road centerline.
The last address number in the range of address numbers on the left side of the road centerline.
The first address number in the range of address numbers on the right side of the road centerline.
The last address number in the range of address numbers on the right side of the road centerline.
A word preceding the Street Name that indicates the direction or position of the thoroughfare relative to an arbitrary starting point or line, or the sector where it is located.
A word or phrase that precedes the Street Name element and identifies a type of thoroughfare in a complete street name.
A word or phrase that precedes the Street Name element and identifies a type of thoroughfare in a complete street name.
A word or phrase that follows the Street Name and identifies a type of thoroughfare.
A word following the Street Name that indicates the direction or position of the thoroughfare relative to an arbitrary starting point or line, or the sector where it is located
The road class field is used when assigning a hierarchy for routing purposes. It essentially makes use of a

edom.edomvd: ALL OTHER TOWNSHIP AND LOCAL ROADS

attr.attrdef: The rate is the value assigned to the road segment that is used to calculate the time to traverse each segment.
The direction of traffic movement in relation to the FROM and TO nodes (i.e. direction of digitization) of the road centerline.

The Full Street Name is the concatenated value of the five parsed out street name fields. It is used for identification and labeling in the map document. It will also be used to provide street name suggestions when typing in CAD.

The principal value is in the case of alias roads that are stacked on top of each other. The value indicates which stacked road segment contains the primary street name information. If the road segment contains the primary road name information, this value should be “0”. If the road segment contains secondary/alias street name information the value should be “-1”.

edom.edomvd: If the road segment contains the primary road name information
If the road segment contains secondary/alias street name information

attr.attrdef: Field used for symbolizing major highways.
The primary Route Number designator (with optional letters) for the road centerline based on MnDOT's routing system. Used mainly for map labelling.
Any city name recognized by the USPS as valid for the ZIP Code of the addresses on the left side of the road centerline.
Any city name recognized by the USPS as valid for the ZIP Code of the addresses on the right side of the road centerline.
The two-character code of the state in which the addresses on the left side of the road centerline are physically located.
The two-character code of the state in which the addresses on the right side of the road centerline are physically located.
The ZIP code for addresses on the left side of the road centerline.
The ZIP code for addresses on the right side of the road centerline.
A 3 to 5-character numeric code that identifies a single Emergency Service Zone (ESZ) for addresses on the left side of the road centerline.
A 3 to 5-character numeric code that identifies a single Emergency Service Zone (ESZ) for addresses on the right side of the road centerline.
Entity responsible for maintenance of the road.
Surface condition of the road.
A Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) for the road segment.
Weight rating of the road for spring weight load restrictions.
User that created the feature.
Date on which the feature was created.
Last user to edit the feature.
The last date that the feature was edited.
The name of the city, township or unorganized territory (CTU) in which addresses on the left side of the road centerline are physically located.
The name of the city, township or unorganized territory (CTU) in which addresses on the right side of the road centerline are physically located.
The county in which the addresses on the left side of the road centerline are physically located.
The county in which the addresses on the right side of the road centerline are physically located.

The street name field as it would appear in the MSAG, as assigned by the local addressing authority, to provide backward compatibility with legacy map displays and Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) systems.
The even or odd property for address numbers on the left side of the road centerline.
The even or odd property for address numbers on the right side of the road centerline.
The 4 to 5-character Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) identifier code from the ELT/ALI display for the addresses on the left side of the road centerline.
The 4 to 5-character Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) identifier code from the ELT/ALI display for the addresses on the right side of the road centerline.
The organization that made the last substantial change to the data record including geospatial edits.
The earliest date on which the road segment is known to exist.
The date on which the road segment was retired from active status.
The primary alternate or alias name for the road centerline.
The secondary alternate or alias name for the road centerline.
A free form field for miscellaneous information that does not fit or is not appropriate in the other attribute fields.
The entity responsible for submitting Geographic Information System (GIS) data to the State of Minnesota to be used for NG9-1-1 service for a specified area.

overview.eaover: This data set contains road polylines that represent the road centerline. All attributes are entered by county staff when new roads are created.

Specifically, the County is not responsible for any costs including, but not limited to, those incurred as a result of lost profits or revenue, loss of use of data, the costs of recovering such programs or data, the costs of any substitute program, claims by third parties, or for other similar costs. User agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the County from any and all claims, actions, suits, or damages including but not limited to, the cost of Attorney's fees in the defense of any claims, arising from User's use or dissemination of the Database herein.
